resources.string: Super Hero Application
BatMan
The superhero protector of Gotham City, a tortured, brooding vigilante dressed as a bat who fights against evil and strikes fear into the hearts of criminals everywhere
Low level superhuman strength, speed, and durability. Peace. Rich.
Black Adam
An ancient Egyptian named Teth-Adam, who is chosen by the wizard Shazam to be his successor due to his presumed moral purity.
Superhuman strength and speed, invulnerability, and flight
Deadpool
A disfigured Canadian mercenary with superhuman regenerative healing abilities.
Accelerated healing factor.
Ghost Rider
A human who can transform into a skeletal superhuman wreathed in ethereal flame and given supernatural powers
Superhuman speed, strength, durability, and a regenerative healing ability
IronMan
The superhero persona of Anthony Edward "Tony" Stark, a businessman and engineer who runs the company Stark Industries
Super strength, the ability to fly, durability, and a number of weapons
Moon Knight
Follows Steven Grant, a mild-mannered gift-shop employee, who becomes plagued with blackouts and memories of another life.
Enhanced strength during nights with full moons, prophetic visions and dreams, and the ability to drain another person is life energies through physical contact.
Professor X
A member of a subspecies of humans known as mutants, who are born with superhuman abilities
Exceptionally powerful telepath, who can read and control the minds of others
SpiderMan
A poor sickly orphan, is bitten by a radioactive spider
Superhuman strength, agility, reflexes, stamina, durability, coordination, and balance, clinging to surfaces and ceilings like a spider, and detecting danger
SuperMan
He wears an outlandish costume, uses a codename, and fights evil with the aid of extraordinary abilities
Strength, speed, stamina, agility, reflexes, longevity, senses, and durability Heat vision Wind and freeze breath Solar energy absorption X-ray vision Flight
Vemon
The poisonous secretion of an animal, produced by specialized glands that are often associated with spines, teeth, stings, or other piercing devices
Scale buildings, take out bodies, and bust through walls
